metadata.title: CVE-2017-10979 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An FR-GV-202 issue in FreeRADIUS 2.x before 2.2.10 allows "Write overflowin rad_coalesce()" - this allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (daemon crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10979` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeradius - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-common - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-iodbc - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-krb5 - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-ldap - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-mysql - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-postgresql - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
freeradius-utils - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
libfreeradius2 - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeradius package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1').
